org.biolegato.sequence.canvas

Class SequenceList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JList
            • org.biolegato.sequence.canvas.SequenceList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable, SequenceCanvasObject

    public final class SequenceList
extends javax.swing.JList
implements SequenceCanvasObject
    The JList of sequences in the Sequence canvas (to the left of the text-area).
    Author:
    Graham Alvare, Brian Fristensky
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SequenceList

        public SequenceList(SequenceCanvas canvas,
                    Dataset datamodel)
        Constructs a new SequenceList
        Parameters:
        canvas - the sequence canvas parent to the sequence list object.
        datamodel - the data model object storing the sequence data.

    • Method Detail

      • changeCase

        public void changeCase()
        Changes the case of the currently selected sequence. If the sequence is of inconsistent case, the case of the first character as the case of the sequence, for case conversion. For example:

        xYzJWwa23 --- will become ---> WYZJWWA23

        Specified by:
        changeCase in interface SequenceCanvasObject

      • deleteSelection

        public void deleteSelection()
        Deletes the currently selected sequences.
        Specified by:
        deleteSelection in interface SequenceCanvasObject

      • readIn

        public void readIn(DataFormat format,
                   java.util.Scanner source,
                   boolean overwrite)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads data into the sequence list.
        Specified by:
        readIn in interface SequenceCanvasObject
        Parameters:
        format - the file format to write the data in.
        source - the data source to read data from.
        overwrite - whether to overwrite the data currently selected in the canvas object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IOException if there is any error reading data from the Scanner object.

      • writeOut

        public void writeOut(DataFormat fmt,
                     java.lang.Appendable dest)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the selected sequences out to an appendable object
        Specified by:
        writeOut in interface SequenceCanvasObject
        Parameters:
        fmt - the format to write the data in.
        dest - the destination Appendable object to write the data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IOException if there is any error appending the data to the Appendable object.
